extendedInfo.description: Easily find the note in a song, and accelerate your learning of playing a song. Sound Sight listens using your microphone and plots the pitches that it hears to the common musical staff.This app used to be called Music 2 Notes now has changed to Sound Sight.As you scroll down the lower pitches are shown, as you scroll up, higher pitches are shown. Roughly In the middle is the human voice.Notes are represented by a green line. Which slides left on the staff. A green line on A4 means that your phone hears a sound with a pitch that you will play on a musical instrument as A4. A blue line means it is a sharp (#). The more green/blue the louder the pitch and the more invisible the quieter the pitch is heard.*** Full paid version now available at ***Sound Sighthttp://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.valeonom.soundsight* It has saving/loading. * up to date improvements & bug fixes * Ad free** Use Cases **You can use it to practice playing an instrument if you know how to read notes, but will not tell you if its a sharp or flat that you are playing unless you are ambitious enough to master matrix mode of Sound Sight (See limitation 6).Find out the composition of pitches that make up your voiceFind out the note of that song you are trying to master (see limitation 6 & 2)If you master matrix mode, you can tune your instrument (see limitation 2)** Limitations **There are some limitation I would like to address so you will not get disappointed.1 - Most forms of music that you listen to everyday have lots of notes being played at the same time. And seeing it all in one screen will be difficult to try and master the tune of 1 particular instrument. 2 - Some instruments like guitar, are not easily computed and you will not see anything useful. The best detected instruments are soft like the flute, recorder, violin and etc... Like wise a song with many instruments will not work very well. A song with around 3 instruments will work fine.3 - This is very processor bound application, and the weakest device M2NC has been tested on is HTC Legend which has a cpu of 600 MHz ARM 11 processor. If you have an older device its best not to get this app. M2NC has been heavily optimized to be smooth on devices as old as HTC however its already reaching such devices processing capability (IE on the edge of what the CPU can handle)4 - Microphone quality is a large factor in display of musical notes.5 - It may not always be so easy to calibrate using the 2 sliders at the top, away from external noise. See calibrating section for info.6 - Sharp and Flat notes are detected but not shown in this version. In a later version perhaps different colors for sharp and flat will be represented. However the algorithms used are tuned to those frequencies. There is a matrix mode where you can see all frequencies that are not shown in staff mode.7 - There is no recording/playback functionality. This and other features will be included in the paid version.Aside from these limitations its a fun toy. From a technical stand point its tuned and optimized for standard musical note frequencies where A4 = 440 hz.Discussionshttp://reddit.com/r/valeonom

reviews.title: Fun
reviews.comment: It\'s fun to play with but says the wrong note
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Okay...
reviews.comment: Struggles on showing the exact notes when you\'re recording but helps me determine notes one at a time.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool idea
reviews.comment: It is a cool idea but it really needs improvement. I am a musician that likes to write music and this app can not always decide what note(s) is being played.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It\'s hard to understand
reviews.comment: I don\'t know which notes are supposed to be playing
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.comment: Would be helpful if you could change the clef to bass clef or Alto Clef (I play the viola) and a MIDI converter also.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great Potential
reviews.comment: This is really cool - I can transcribed the notes to practice with whilst I work on my listening skills, would be brilliant if it could output notes to a text file, eg A A A B     A#BCE   sort of thing or music score sheet.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.comment: But need to add midi export......
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty cool
reviews.comment: I agree with some of the other comments saying this has real potential. In the meantime, the functionality that it has is still very entertaining.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: I love it
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.comment: Was not to bad but could do with a little more fazaz

reviews.comment: horrible!

reviews.title: get this.
reviews.comment: this has real potential. what I really want is to see my hummed tunes turned into written musical notation -with note lengths too!

reviews.comment: Sad, this sounded exactly like what I was looking for =[ Unfortunately the treble clef does NOT line up correctly, it is just for decoration. Droid X
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Its ok, not always accurate.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Wish I could record and save as pdf
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool
reviews.comment: I\'m just learning the Violin and i can whistle the tune and this app shows me the notes I\'m whistling.   That\'s cool.  Also seems to help with my intonation as well.  Thanks for the app.
reviews.author: Russell Mitchem
